data.question: What is the molecular structure used to form a 3D kagome-type structure in the study?
What role do copper(II) complexes play in the study?
data.answer: Copper(II) complexes play an important role in oxidation catalysis.

data.question: What is the yield percentage of 2,3-bis(nicotinoyloxy)naphthalene (L) from its synthesis?
True or False: The solvate CH2Cl2 and water molecules are not refined by X-ray analysis.
What is the effect of the coordinate solvent molecules on the catalysis rate?
data.answer: The catalysis rate is inversely proportional to the degree of interactions between the coordinate solvent molecules and the copper(II) ions.

data.question: True or False: The catalytic activity of the copper(II) compounds is less effective than that of silica-supported heterogeneous copper(II) compounds.
What happens to the 3D kagome supra-channel structure when the coordinate solvent molecules are evaporated?
True or False: The catalysis using the coordinate-solvent-molecules-evaporated sample was effective.
What substrate is used for oxidation catalysis in the study?
True or False: The catalysis was achieved in homogeneous methanol solution.
What is the role of carbon monoxide molecules in the study?
data.answer: Carbon monoxide molecules are employed as a ligand by coordinate solvent molecules under 5 atm at RT.

data.question: True or False: The CO coordinate sample returned to its original 3D kagome supra-channel structure via a simple gas adsorption.
What is the outcome when the evaporated sample adsorbed the solvents again?
data.answer: Its catalytic effect was almost equal to that of the original sample.

data.question: True or False: The surface area and coordinate solvents of the supra-channel structure were insignificant factors in the catalysis.
What is the solvent-occupied volume range for the 3D kagome-type structure?
True or False: The catalysis in CH3CN results in stoichiometric oxidation due to the chelation of the oxidized species, 3,5-DBBQ, to copper(II) ions.
What is the effect of the reversible supra-channel effects on the catalysis?
data.answer: The reversible supra-channel effects systematically studied on the oxidation catalysis of 3,5-DBCat to 3,5-DBBQ.

data.question: True or False: The catalysis using the CO coordinate sample was as effective as the original sample.
What is the main feature of supramolecular materials highlighted in the study?
data.answer: The most important feature of supramolecular materials is porosity.

data.question: True or False: The study reports the formation of a 3D kagome-type structure using molecular arrays of 1D coordination polymers for the first time.
